intro: Rhynchospora divergens, commonly known as the broad-leaved spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in spikes during the summer months. Rhynchospora divergens typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, contributing to wetland ecosystems. Its presence is often an indicator of healthy, undisturbed wetland habitats.
